result.execSummary:
The defendant George Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Cause Mental/BodilyHarm, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $274.00, to be paid to the Crime Victim Compensation Program.

Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.
Maintain full time employment or a combination of employment and school part time to obtain GED/HSED or vocational education.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No contact with the victim. 
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16.

Complete sex offender evaluation and comply with treatment and counseling if deemed necessary.
Court will defer ruling on sex offender registration until the Probation Review Hearing date on April 8, 2016. 
*8/17/2016  Court finds that it is not necessary for the defendant to report as a sex offender from this date forward.

timeConds.notes: FORTHWITH, with Huber release for employment, vocational or educational programs, to include the Day Report Center if applicable.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George Long in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing from both parties and the defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 4 YEARS with the following conditions:

1) Restitution in the amount of $274.00, to be paid to the Crime Victim Compensation Program. 
2) Complete sex offender evaluation and comply with treatment and counseling if deemed necessary.
3) Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
4) Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
5) No contact with the victim. 
6) No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16.
7) Maintain full time employment or a combination of employment and school part time to obtain GED/HSED or vocational education.
8) Court ordered 90 days of condition time in the House of Correction FORTHWITH, with Huber release for employment, vocational or educational programs, to include the Day Report Center if applicable.

If revoked, defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program. The defendant is not appropriate for the Substance Abuse Program.

If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.

It is the courts intention that if revoked, the conditions of extended supervision are to be the same as probation conditions.

Court will defer ruling on sex offender registration until the Probation Review Hearing date. 

Defense counsel requested the Court allow the defendant to have contact with his children. Court denied defense request. Court will entertain a motion for modification of the no unsupervised contact order at a future date. Defense counsel may file the motion in branch 25.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Restitution Form from CVC Program.
Case adjourned to branch 25.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 2/23/15 for Isabella P. c/o Michelle S. for 1 appearance on 2/23/15.

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Court ordered defendant to give a DNA sample after court today. Bail remains the same. Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant George Long in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Court finds the State has complied with victim's rights legislation. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Child Enticement, contrary to sec. 948.07(5), 939.50(3)(d) Wis. Stats., a Class D Felony.
